resources.string: After 20 minutes: Your blood pressure and heart rate decrease.
After 8 hours: The carbon monoxide level in your blood returns to normal.
After 24 hours: Your chance of heart attack decreases.
After 48 hours: Your ability to taste and smell starts to return.
After 72 hours: Your airways start to relax.
After 5 to 8 days: The average number of cravings is reduced to 3 per day.
After 10 to 14 days: Blood circulation in your gums and teeth returns to normal. Cravings are reuced to 2 per day (average).
After 2 to 12 weeks: Your circulation improves and your lung function increases.
After 3 to 4 weeks: Cessation related anger, anxiety, restlessness and depression have ended.
After 2 months: Insulin resistance has normalized despite average weight gain of 5.95 lb (2.7kg)
After 1 to 9 months: Coughing and shortness of breath decrease.
After 1 to 5 years: Your risk of dying from heart isease is about half that of a smoker.
After 10 years: Your risk of lung cancer falls to about half that of a smoker.
